urls.title: Some Trump supporters in this Georgia county say the election system is 'rigged.' That could hurt Republicans in January
urls.description: Sixty miles west of Atlanta, Haralson County sits a world away from Georgia's largest and booming metro area. Here, in the small towns that sit in the foothills of the Appalachian mountains, Republican roots run generations deep. In November, the county voted for Donald Trump over Joe Biden, 87% to 13% -- making it one of the most Republican-leaning areas in the state.

text: Republicans are relying on an enthusiastic base in places like Haralson County, Georgia, to vote for incumbent Republican Sens. Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue in the runoffs, driven by the popularity of President Trump https://t.co/TycoEZv7Vw
